comments:
Eclipse 3.1, WTP 0.7, Oracle 9

I can make a connection, I can browse schemas available to the current user, but
all schemas are empty. Even the one the user should be able to access (have
prooved that it should work using DbVisualiser usind the same driver) - just
schema names, no content - no tables, not synonyms.

I experience the same problem. The following shows up when trying to expand a
schema node:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at
org.eclipse.wst.rdb.internal.core.definition.DatabaseDefinitionImpl.supportsSequence(DatabaseDefinitionImpl.java:840)
	at
org.eclipse.wst.rdb.server.internal.ui.explorer.providers.content.layout.vnode.ServerExplorerVNodeContentProviderNav.displaySchemaChildren(ServerExplorerVNodeContentProviderNav.java:105)
<snip>

I hit the same problem with Oracle 10 but noticed that I could connect to it if 
I set it up an Oracle 8 connection.

So I played with Oracle_9.xmi a little bit.  Discovered that if I removed 

  <predefinedDataTypeDefinitions xmi:id="XML_TYPE_1" primitiveType="XML_TYPE" 
jdbcEnumType="509" orderingSupported="false" groupingSupported="false">
    <name>XMLTYPE</name>
  </predefinedDataTypeDefinitions>

that it all started working again.  I didn't investigate anymore as I was happy 
enough for the moment (don't use that type).  

When connecting I use (if it matters or helps) the thin driver in the URL, 
oracle.jdbc.OracleDriver as the JDBC Driver class and I'm picking it up from 
classes12.

Rafal,

I will check into what is causing the exception first. Just want to bring to 
your attention that the Oracle contribution in WTP is based on SQLModel 
(schema contains sequence) , hence should be supported by design, however, 
since we don't have specialized catalog loading to load Oracle sequence (it is 
using the generic JDBC loader). In any event, it should not cause exception.

As for your problem on empty schema, what was the catalog you selected? User, 
DAB or ALL?

Thanks,

Der ping

I get an exception "Could not acquire children from extension: class 
org.eclipse.wst.common.navigator.internal.views.extensions.NavigatorContentProvi
der" whenever I try to expand any of the schemas.

(In reply to comment #2)

You can actually leave XML_TYPE in the Oracle 9 and 10 db definitions.  I 
simply removed the [orderingSupported="false" groupingSupported="false"] text 
from both XML_TYPE definitions and things work fine for either version after 
that.
*** Bug 140731 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I have verified with the latest wtp build, the tables are loaded in server 
explorer. Form the exception stack, the problem was in database definition. 
Looks like it was already fixed. I tried both classes12.jar and classes111.jar.

I will resolve this defect. If it's still the issue, please let me know.

Thanks!
-April
